Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with uncertain pattern in added white above two white bands; exterior: six narrow brown lines, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 916.3 is written in pencil on a paper label glues to the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 170, no. 213)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 733, no. 933)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1944) (phase 2)
